TestDescription.name: PHP allow_url_include enabled
TestDescription.Description: The PHP configuration directive allow_url_include is enabled. When enabled, this directive allows data retrieval from remote locations (web site or FTP server) for functions like fopen and file_get_contents. If user input is not properly validated, this can conduct to remote file inclusion vulnerabilities. [break][break]allow_url_include is disabled by default. If allow_url_fopen is disabled, allow_url_include is also disabled. This setting is only available since PHP 5.2.
TestDescription.Impact: Application dependant - possible remote file inclusion.
TestDescription.Recommendation: You can disable allow_url_include from php.ini or .htaccess.[break][break][bold]php.ini[/bold][break]allow_url_include = 'off'[break][break][bold].htaccess[/bold][break]php_flag allow_url_include off[break]
